intro: Sclerostachya fallax, commonly known as the slender grassvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically covered with a fine layer of hair, and its flowers are arranged in dense clusters. Sclerostachya fallax thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks.
